quest.name: Storm on the Horizon
journal: The Empire is on the move, and Hien would not be caught on the back foot.
objectives: Speak with Hien at Castrum Fluminis.
Speak with Yugiri at the mercantile docks.
Speak with Hien at the Doman Enclave.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It is as Lord Hien says. The Empire is on the move. And we, as ever, find ourselves on the back foot...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Jifuya can't be the only one here with a mortal fear of Yotsuyu. She tormented these people.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: That her mere presence should sow such strife...

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Lord Hien and Master Alphinaud look troubled... Something is afoot.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: While you were out searching for Jifuya, we received word from our shinobi allies: an imperial airship has been sighted over Doman soil.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Our visitors' objective remains unclear. It may be another attempt to recover Yotsuyu...or a prelude to invasion.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Either way, the craft reportedly advances at speed, and appears bound for Castrum Fluminis. I mean to go there and ascertain their intent.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: If we ride out in force, it will only end one way, so we shall keep our numbers to a minimum. Yugiri, Forename─can I count on you?

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Yes, my lord.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Alisaie and I would fain play our part as well. We will not stand idly by while a common foe threatens the lands of our friends and allies.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: We would be glad of the help. You are acquainted with Hakuro, I believe? Then I bid you seek him out and assist in maintaining order in the enclave.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: When the people see an imperial airship, they are liable to panic. I would have you reassure them, and, should it come to it, aid in their evacuation.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Very well. We shall depart at once. Do take care.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: What of me, my lord?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: The Empire may well be after Yotsuyu. You are to remain here and guard her until my return.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: ...As you wish. Pray stay close to Forename and Yugiri.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Well, well... Guard duty and not a breath of protest. Now I have seen it all.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: To Castrum Fluminis, then. Let us find out what the Empire's game is.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Doma is ill-equipped to deal with an aerial offensive. Should the Empire be so minded, the Xaela's flying mounts would be our only hope.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: The area is secure. Whatever our visitors' purpose, they plainly believe they can achieve it alone.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: The craft should come into view at any moment. Let us await them inside the castrum.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Peace... After all they have done. Never has the word rung more hollow.

dialogue.name: ASAHI
dialogue.text: I say, do I stand in the presence of the fabled eikon-slayer? What an honor.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Lord Hien is magnanimous in victory. Given our nations' troubled history, we did not expect such hospitality.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: We shall escort our guests across the river to the enclave.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Yugiri, pray go on ahead to the Yuzuka Manor docks and see that the ferries are ready.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Upon disembarking, we will proceed directly to my hall, where we may enjoy some privacy.

dialogue.name: ASAHI
dialogue.text: Such scenes of devastation greeted us on our journey here... The bitter wages of war.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: I have read much about the architecture and geology of Doma... Words do not do it justice.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Lord Hien and I will accompany the imperial delegation on the first ferry.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: When you are ready, speak with the boatman and join us on the other side.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Lord Hien has requested that Master Alphinaud and Mistress Alisaie also be present at the negotiation.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: There you are, Forename. So, first things first: what do you think of the enclave? I must say, I'm quite proud of what my countrymen have accomplished in the time.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: We even have an aetheryte now, courtesy of the Onishishu. Be sure and attune to it, would you? Once it has the Warrior of Light's seal of approval, people might actually start using the thing.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: But on to the matter at hand: the ambassador and his retinue are at my hall, taking their ease ahead of the negotiations. I want you there when the talking starts.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: It will serve to send a message to the Empire that Eorzea and Doma stand united. I am not normally one for hollow posturing, but in this game of nations, such gestures carry weight.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Oh, and should you feel uneasy about speaking for the Scions, Alphinaud and Alisaie will also be there. You need only eat, drink, and look imposing. Say you'll come.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'll be there.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Oh, very well.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: I knew I could count on you.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: It promises to be a dull affair, to be sure, but you have survived far worse.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: When you are ready, come and join me at my humble abode, the Kienkan. The guardsman will see you in.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Lord Hien is expecting you. May I show you in?

dialogue.name: EVENTAREA
dialogue.text: Enter the Kienkan?

dialogue.name: HAKURO
dialogue.text: Whatever Lord Hien's decision should be, I shall abide by it. Yet...I would be glad to welcome my lost brothers back to Doma.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The fact that there are two opposing factions at work in Garlemald complicates matters. Even assuming Asahi and his associates can be trusted, what of the others?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That the Empire should send Yotsuyu's stepbrother of all people... I wonder how he feels, a son of Doma returning home to speak for the oppressors his countrymen drove out.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Well, that was...unexpected.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You can say that again. I still don't know quite what to make of it all. But on the surface, a prisoner exchange does seem a good way to begin. The question is, can they be trusted?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Hm. They had naught to gain by divulging the details of their internal divisions. As it stands, we have no reason to doubt them.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: But the ambassador's mention of Yotsuyu left me ill at ease. It made his grand talk of peace seem uncannily like a lengthy preamble.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You think this might all be a ruse to facilitate her retrieval?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Perhaps. Though I cannot fathom why they would go to such lengths. Yotsuyu may have been the acting viceroy, but she is not Garlean, nor even highborn. Her value must presumably lie in what she knows...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: ...Which brings us to the little matter of her memory loss. In her present condition, she would not yield any worthwhile intelligence. Nor is she worth much as a bargaining piece.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Alphinaud, you are well acquainted with the Empire's methods. I would have your thoughts on this matter.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: My knowledge is at your disposal, Lord Hien. While the ambassador's proposal is appealing in principle, it would be remiss of us not to give it due scrutiny.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Indeed. Though it seems to me I have little choice but to accept regardless. With so many of our brothers and sisters languishing in imperial camps, I cannot well turn my back on a chance to secure their repatriation. Only the kami know when I will be afforded another.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: ...But ere we continue, shall we excuse these two? I fear what follows will bore them to tears.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I was just about to show myself out as it happens. Come on, Forename─let's leave Alphinaud to dispense his copious knowledge.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Someone is still sore from being made to watch at Sakazuki...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Go on and keep Alisaie company. We are safe enough for now.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Worry not, Forename, we shall take care of the rest. Go on and keep Alisaie company.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: You've more than earned a rest, my friend. Leave the interminable bits to us.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: <sigh> A chance to relax at last.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I know when I'm out of my depth, Forename.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Though no weapons are drawn, a negotiation is no less a battle, and the stakes can be every bit as high. One misplaced word and people could die. It takes someone with a cool head, and I'll be the first to admit that's not me.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text:
So we're left with the eternal question...
What to do while they prattle on?
